Package btindices.indicesmanager

Class FilterExplorationManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • btindices.indicesmanager.FilterExplorationManager
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    FilterExplorationManagerIndices, FilterExplorationManagerPlainHDT
    public abstract class FilterExplorationManager
extends Object
    A class which provides methods in order to explore a given HDT file by the principles of Faceted Navigation.

      • thresAvailableFilters

        public long thresAvailableFilters
        If all available facets are calculated for the current set of resources and the number of resources "n" is less than the specified threshold, for each resource a HDT search is performed in O(log(#hdtFileTriples)) and each result is added in O(1) to the updated hash set: n * O(log(#hdtFileTriples)) + O(#result). If n >= threshold, only one HDT search is performed on the POS index in order to fetch all resources which are annotated with the corresponding facet. Subsequently, it is iterated over all fetched resources and it is examined whether the resource is in the current center set: log(size(#triplesTypeIndex)) + O(#annotatedResourcesFromIndex))

      • thresApplyFilter

        public long thresApplyFilter
        If the size of the current set of resources M while filtering the set is less than the threshold, for each resource r from M it is examined if the triple (r, filterPred, filterValue) is contained in the bitmap triples. Else the triple pattern (0, filterPred, filterValue) is resolved and all resources are stored to a hash set. Subsequently, it is iterated over all resources from M and examined if they are present in the newly calculated hash set.

      • predicates

        protected Iterator<? extends CharSequence> predicates
        All predicates of the HDT dictionary.

      • applyFacet

        public abstract void applyFacet​(boolean outgoing,
                                long facetID,
                                long facetValueID)
        Applies a filter to the current set of resources.
        Parameters:
        outgoing - Indicates if an outgoing filter, i.e., f = (?s, pred, obj), or an incoming filter, i.e., f = (sbj, pred, ?o), is applied to the current center.
        facetID - Predicate ID which corresponds to the ID of the respective HDT dictionary.
        facetValueID - Object ID which corresponds to the ID of the HDT dictionary.

      • getSubsetOfHashSet

        public abstract org.eclipse.collections.impl.set.mutable.UnifiedSet<Long> getSubsetOfHashSet​(org.eclipse.collections.impl.set.mutable.UnifiedSet<Long> center,
                                                                                             long facetID,
                                                                                             long facetValue,
                                                                                             boolean outgoing)
        Returns a subset of a hash set which is annotated by the corresponding facet and facetValue, i.e., a given property-value pair.
        Parameters:
        outgoing - If this value is true, the facet value acts as object, otherwise as subject.
        Returns:
